column1: The United States shattered its record of COVID-19 cases today.   We will be far better off in the long run if we closely follow the advice of our public health experts.   Connecticut we cannot let up now.

I'm deeply concerned by today’s 6.1% positivity rate the highest since June 1 & the new report from @YaleSPH showing #COVID19 concentrations in the New Haven area.   In the past this research accurately predicted a surge in hospitalizations 3-5 days out. https://t.co/vWflb5m4Si

I'm proud to see this #CARESAct funding reach CT’s small businesses.   If you run a small business or non-profit with less than 20 employees apply for this federally funded grant to help with COVID-19 recovery.   More information can be found here⤵️ https://t.co/DDJMo9rqMj

Proud to use my leadership in the House to bring federal dollars back to CT. As the chair of the subcommittee that funds CDC this $20M will improve our District’s ability to respond to #COVID19.  We must get this pandemic under control.   https://t.co/6oITsr5kGg

As a lifelong advocate of our arts and culture industry I am fighting hard to secure additional relief for the artists and artistic entities that are a foundation of Connecticut’s economy.    COVID-19 is jeopardizing and gutting this industry.   https://t.co/71RTbSNPfv

Connecticut has seen a 75% increase in COVID-19 cases over the last two weeks. We cannot let our guard down now–the impact is real. Get tested wear a mask social distance—people's lives depend on it. https://t.co/MNNBHxcmNS

This week I joined @ChrisMurphyCT & local leaders to thank the front line workers & doctors at Fairhaven Community Health Center in New Haven for the incredible work they have done & continue to do to fight COVID-19. If you need a test get a test—they offer free testing M-F 9-5 https://t.co/Lj1G8YXCCR

I wish the circumstances were different but I'm thrilled to have helped lead the charge to include $8B for nutrition programs. #COVID19 continues to leave families struggling to keep food on the table.  It's now up to the President to sign this legislation without hesitation.

➡️$7B for Child Care Development Block Grants ➡️$225B to support the educational needs of States school districts and institutions of higher education in response to coronavirus  We must pass this critical relief.

We’re delivering #ForThePeople but @senatemajldr and Republicans are standing in the way because of special interests. With #COVID19 threatening lives and livelihoods the stakes are higher than ever. https://t.co/GbB08qNyas

It’s all about the color! Who’s starting #MaskRater?  Thank you @ChrisMurphyCT for bringing us together. While CT is leading the way in the COVID response there is more to be done to help towns like Wallingford to get back on its feet. https://t.co/vFLYtD50ER
If you missed last night's Tele-Town Hall on #COVID19 with @ashishkjha hit my SoundCloud for the full discussion⤵️  https://t.co/VlxMSQjK1K

Changes to testing made quietly by CDC fly in the face of science. Countries that have controlled the spread of COVID-19 do not just test those with symptoms.  Funding was not provided for the purpose of minimizing the case count.  We need answers to these political changes. https://t.co/JGUpV2ngww

Thank you @GriffinHospital CEO Patrick Charmel for joining me today to highlight the impact of the $8.7M I helped secure in #COVID19 relief for Griffin.  Our partnership and advocacy were key to securing this funding.  CT hospitals need more. The Senate must pass the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/S2Qyhly8wJ

This is incredible promising news coming from Yale. I’m hopeful this less invasive less expensive test means we are one step closer to stopping the spread of COVID-19 and ending this pandemic. https://t.co/42dRGGarlV

Findings in this report are another example of this administration's fumbled response to #COVID19 & the continued sacrifice of working families.   It is our duty to protect workers. The #FamiliesFirstAct must be implemented as passed and signed into law.  https://t.co/zELhhfytTF
If not we will surely see a wave of mass evictions across the country unlike anything we have seen in modern history given the COVID-19 pandemic.

We need to be paying attention to the abuse and atrocities committed by this administration under the guise of stopping the spread of the coronavirus.   I sent a letter on this to Secretary Azar and Director Redfield and requested a response by July 20—but I’ve heard nothing.

For decades @USDA has enabled corporate meatpackers to exploit black and brown workers in America’s dangerous meat and poultry plants. COVID-19 has exposed these injustices and compounded the problem. https://t.co/IohQz5bPer

Reports that the administration ordered hospitals to bypass CDC and send coronavirus patient information to a central database in Washington are in direct violation with the law – this reporting is not optional.

#COVID19 has pinpointed to us where our support system is not as strong as we believed it to be as strong as our families our farmers & our food workers need it to be. I'm glad this bill is making short-term & long-term investments. My remarks on the FY21 ag spending bill⤵️ https://t.co/J8Loyv8ykH

Wishing everyone a safe & happy #4thofJuly 🇺🇸  As a nation I hope that we can spend today reflecting on our history & commitment to creating a more just & fair society for all.   Please remember to take necessary precautions to protect yourself & your loved ones from COVID-19.

Schools across the country are planning to reopen in a few months. Without adequate funding millions of youngsters & teachers are at risk for COVID-19. Congress must #FundOurPublicSchools to ensure our schools are properly equipped with the tools they need to safely reopen.

#COVID19 continues to cause devastating health & economic impacts for women & their families especially women of color. @HouseDemocrats passed a relief package weeks ago yet @SenateMajLdr has left it sitting on his desk with no new plan. Senate GOP must pass the #HeroesAct now.

The Trump administration's attempt to take away affordable health coverage for millions of Americans is indefensible—especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. This administration’s cruelty knows no bounds. https://t.co/R61yPjrDDg

Getting any sort of information from this administration has been virtually impossible during this pandemic and taxpayers have a right to know how their dollars are being spent on COVID-19 drugs. https://t.co/Qe0Cy1v5EV

Today I am proud to co-lead bipartisan legislation to prevent price gouging prohibit monopolies & ensure transparency on taxpayer funded COVID-19 drugs. Big Pharma has taken advantage of government investment in biomedical research by price gouging customers. https://t.co/UCMcjnQ8mW

Due to safety concerns the FDA will withdraw emergency use authorization for hydroxychloroquine to treat COVID-19. 53 days ago I asked @SecWilkie to stop prescribing our veterans the dangerous ineffective drug & still have not received a response. Our veterans deserve better.

Today marks 50 days since I wrote @SecWilkie demanding answers on why our veterans continue to be prescribed hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19. 50 days and no answer.  The American people and our veterans deserve better. https://t.co/WMkMLdYgFq
This moment exposes so may wrongs deep inequality and racial wrongs. And that as we fight the COVID-19 virus before us now we must also fight the virus of injustice.

This fall we will face the flu & the coronavirus at the same time—people must be vaccinated. With companies across the country racing towards a vaccine & the strain that it will put it will put on hospitals & infrastructure we need a budget from the CDC—and we need it now. https://t.co/E4hZlNozgu

We are being told that it is safe to reopen. 20000+ new cases 1000+ deaths. We do not have the resources we need to prevent more deaths. The Federal response to COVID-19 has been inconsistent and incoherent and the President wants us to pretend like it is business as usual. https://t.co/JE9IMYmw3C

Our nation is in turmoil. The coronavirus is the biggest public health crisis we have experienced in at least a century and the Federal response has been inconsistent and incoherent. https://t.co/xXbReRqz0t

HAPPENING NOW: Tune in live as @CDCDirector Dr. Robert Redfield provides an update on the CDC's response to COVID-19 before my House Appropriations subcommittee. The American people deserve answers. https://t.co/QTPR38U5Mv

CT families can now use their SNAP benefits to purchase groceries online. COVID-19 has exacerbated the problem of hunger in our communities and this is an important step in helping more people safely put food on the table at this critical time. https://t.co/vjDuOPMU72

Welcomed news! @CTDOTOfficial will receive an additional $206M that will go directly to CTtransit & the New Haven Line rail service as a result of the CARES Act. This funding will ensure that are able to maintain & manage our public transportation system in response to COVID-19.

Day 39: Still no response from @SecWilkie to my letter on veterans being prescribed hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19. How many more days will it take for you stop putting their lives in jeopardy from this dangerous drug? Our veterans deserve an answer.

Day 35. Still no answers from VA Secretary Wilkie to my letter on our veterans being prescribed hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19. Will you address this issue at the hearing you’re testifying at today? The science is clear—this is dangerous to their health. https://t.co/CZ0rXu8r4j

Day 34 and still no response from @SecWilkie and the Trump administration on veterans being prescribed hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19. Their lives are at risk from this dangerous drug and Congress deserves answers.
33 days and counting since I sent a letter to @SecWilkie on veterans being prescribed hydroxychloroquine for COVID-19. Still no response. https://t.co/LkpnVkzrDM

New study confirms what we knew in April when I wrote to VA Secretary Wilkie: hydroxychloroquine increases COVID-19 patients' risk of death. It’s been a month and still no response. Why are veterans being prescribed this drug? We need answers. -Rosa https://t.co/DUZWpmU6bw
Online purchases for Connecticut families with SNAP benefits will help them keep food on their table while mitigating the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/xH3YkmK5nO
COVID-19 has exacerbated the problem of hunger in our communities which makes helping families put food on their table is more critical than ever.

The coronavirus pandemic has hit Connecticut particularly hard so innovative solutions like this that help prevent the spread of this deadly disease are critical to defeating this public health and economic crisis.

Last week the House of Representatives passed the HEROES Act—a new coronavirus response package that greatly expands our nation's social safety net. The Heroes Act will help protect our workers our families our small businesses and those who have fallen through the cracks. https://t.co/sg7lvW4LaJ
Going live on @WTNH in a few minutes for a COVID-19 town hall. Tune in. https://t.co/LLioQLHmJE

Excellent testimony today from Dr. Rick Bright who was removed from @BARDA for saying hydroxychloroquine does not help treat COVID-19—a finding backed by data. @SecWilkie: why are you still using this on our nation’s veterans? They are not test subjects. -Rosa

The Heroes Act is a comprehensive coronavirus response package to tackle the biggest public health and economic crisis our country has ever faced and I am proud to have shaped it in key areas.  https://t.co/jlFff5gmFO
Tune in LIVE as we give an update of our COVID-19 response at the national and local levels. https://t.co/vSnhWRWA6C

Children are especially at economic risk during the COVID-19 pandemic. We can help kids now by expanding & improving the Child Tax Credit in the next COVID-19 response package. Read more about my plan w/ @RepDelBene @SenSherrodBrown & @SenatorBennet: https://t.co/6ADgb7UKkM

It is crucial that we #FundFamilies by including an expanded and improved fully refundable Child Tax Credit in the next coronavirus response package. That is why I wrote a letter with @RepDelBene and 58 of my colleagues today urging House and Senate leaders to do just that. https://t.co/FSkFSicD4f

COVID-19 puts our most vulnerable at risk especially seniors. That’s I joined @RepJohnLarson on the Emergency Social Security Benefits Improvement Act to #ExpandSocialSecurity and protect our seniors.  https://t.co/WAzQ0khSeF

According to a range of projections new daily cases of COVID-19 could surge this month. Some are projecting that deaths could rise to 3000 people each day. It would be irresponsible to reopen the economy without proper testing capacity across the country. https://t.co/LU6UZ6yP6D

In the near term as we work to mitigate the spread of the coronavirus. In the medium-term as we develop the therapeutics to treat the disease and a vaccine to inoculate millions of Americans against the coronavirus.

Science and facts must drive our policy & that demands hearing from the doctors scientists researchers & experts who command those facts & drive science to public policy. The purpose of today’s hearing is to get a clear-eyed view of the path forward for responding to COVID-19: https://t.co/D7rTRAn6q3
The people of this country deserve to know how our federal government is handling the COVID-19 pandemic and what the path forward looks like. Tune in live at 10am. https://t.co/F3gYpiUfN0

It’s  #SmallBusinessWeek.  As we continue to battle COVID-19 I want to recognize small businesses like Sunset Technologies in Woodbridge who are using their expertise in 3-D printing to produce face shields for first responders. TY Sunset Technologies. https://t.co/JA2rQgcU3s

Senate Republicans snuck in a $135 billion tax giveaway for the wealthiest in the same coronavirus response law that gave working people in Connecticut and across the country $1200 or less. That is unconscionable and it needs to be repealed immediately. https://t.co/ZHKAkK1aBF

As Congress continues work on future coronavirus response legislation Ag and food must be a key component. We must act on increasing the SNAP benefit allowing those benefits to be used online and finding innovative ways to move food from struggling farmers to people in need.

Today at 3PM I will host a live webinar with @Rosemary100 and @WallachLori to discuss COVID-19's impact on the medical supply chain and looming drug shortages. Watch here: https://t.co/DDIhLZkDzJ https://t.co/kQfkxxQPLb
Tune in LIVE as I talk with @PaulJBass about Congress voting on the fourth coronavirus response package today and mental health issues people in our community are facing. https://t.co/nlZ5QzMpfE
Instead Stephen Miller and other anti-immigrant zealots in the Trump administration are operating under the shadow of COVID-19 to keep kids from being placed with sponsors.

Even in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic—which has killed tens of thousands of Americans and demands the undivided attention of our federal government—the Trump administration remains focused on inflicting trauma on unaccompanied children. https://t.co/yxq1Bs043c

Everyone has experienced the COVID-19 pandemic in different ways and has a unique story to tell. I want to hear from you directly. Let me know how you’ve been impacted on my website: https://t.co/s4D0iEFWcw https://t.co/Faz20HeyTw

In response to COVID-19 Congress passed the first national standard for paid sick days & #paidleave for all. There’s still more work to be done to make these benefits permanent and expand access but I encourage you to take advantage of these provisions. https://t.co/EtMTaOc6MM

To help student borrowers Congress’s third coronavirus response package pauses monthly loan payments on Department of Education owned-loans through September 30th. And until that date interest will not accrue on your loans.

Over the last few weeks I have heard from thousands of people in Connecticut who are struggling to make ends meet—including those who have lost their job or had to leave their college or university early due to the coronavirus. https://t.co/FjXueDQzAq

Today at 12 PM EST I will be holding a live telephone town hall meeting to provide a federal update on the coronavirus. To participate dial 855-920-0553 or live stream the event on my website at https://t.co/lg3pkF0ySO. I look forward to hearing from you.

TOMORROW: Join me for a live telephone town hall meeting where I will provide a federal update on the coronavirus. To participate dial 855-920-0553 at 12 PM or sign up via the link below to be added to the call. I look forward to speaking with you. https://t.co/lg3pkF0ySO

Connecticut will receive nearly $500 million to cover operating expenses for state wide transportation services as a result of the CARES Act—ensuring that we will be able to maintain and manage our public transportation system in response to COVID-19.  https://t.co/KWaOOfcGcB

CT has taken strong measures to stop the spread of COVID-19 but small businesses are suffering. To help fill the gap Congress approved $10 billion in disaster relief grants & $349 billion in loans for small & tribal businesses nonprofits ind. contractors & the self-employed. https://t.co/kWKJYgM3d8

Today we finally have a national standard for paid sick days thanks to the Families First Coronavirus Response Act that Congress passed—17 years after I started working on the #HealthyFamiliesAct. Now we need a permanent solution & #PaidLeaveForAll.

.@GovNedLamont announced that 60+ credit unions and banks have pledged to offer relief for those who have fallen behind on mortgage payments in wake of COVID-19. This includes a 90 day grace period for mortgages and no foreclosures for 60 days. https://t.co/jMfNGdHPUX

Connecticut residents looking for federal state and local resources for your health and economic security throughout the coronavirus pandemic can find them here on my website. This page is updated regularly. Please stay safe: https://t.co/hZUXPjeadb

Women’s work needs to be valued the same as men’s—especially as we deal with COVID-19. Most low-wage workers are women. Their work is essential. They are on the frontline in healthcare caregiving food service & grocery stores. They deserve equal pay for equal work. #EqualPayDay https://t.co/AKOGXqUAkO

If you lost your job recently due to the coronavirus you could eligible for Connecticut unemployment benefits. If you are you will also receive an additional $600 per week from the federal government through the end of July. To file a claim visit: https://t.co/X5kpkeLbem https://t.co/XRZcozlhYs

COVID-19 is the biggest economic and health crisis our country has ever faced. Nurses and doctors are in ICUs trying to save our humanity against this awful pandemic. The hour is dark but Congress is ready to help get families workers and the country to the dawn of recovery. https://t.co/PK7xVzyWl6

Going LIVE at 11am with @PaulJBass @newhavenindy to talk about the latest coronavirus response bill in Congress what’s happening in our community and how we can all get through this. Watch here on Facebook and ask a question: https://t.co/5voDGsgNZU

Any one of us can contract the coronavirus and we must do our best to prevent further illnesses and deaths—especially for vulnerable populations like our seniors and those with underlying health issues.

Congress needs to act urgently to continue addressing the health and economic crisis facing families. We swiftly passed two important coronavirus response bills thus far but we must do much more to control the spread of this virus.

My thoughts and prayers are with the families of the two individuals in our District who died from complications due to the coronavirus. This pandemic is on our doorstep and we must do everything we can to stop it.  https://t.co/XlIkA94TSr
The most effective way to combat COVID-19 is to continue to practice social distancing. Your safety is my top priority. https://t.co/YOMByq9Nhl

Please heed the advice of health agencies and medical professionals regarding medications or other treatments for the coronavirus. If you believe you have symptoms or have questions please consult with your doctor and follow preventative guidelines issued by the @CDCgov. https://t.co/GRgQZjcNrj

While public health officials work to limit the spread of the coronavirus @AABB & the Red Cross are calling for blood donors to avoid disruptions to the blood supply. To volunteer visit: https://t.co/ChDBhaIEPF https://t.co/KnH4fCnHw5

Thank you to our healthcare workers and first responders for your work as we deal with the coronavirus pandemic. Every day you are putting your lives on the line to keep us safe and you have my endless gratitude for that. https://t.co/p29DvXApcX
Work sharing programs were a bright spot in the aftermath of the financial crisis and we should immediately reinstate federal support for them in the next coronavirus response package.

Businesses are closing and people are losing their jobs right now because of the coronavirus pandemic. Working people and families are facing an unprecedented threat to their economic security. https://t.co/svsCJfMKLo

The absence of direct funding for programs that millions of people rely on is a mistake that must be fixed. As the debate continues over the third coronavirus response package I will fight to make sure working people and families are put first.

During this public health emergency the End Hunger CT SNAP call center will remain in full operation. If you have any questions related to SNAP or SNAP services during COVID-19 please call 866-974-7627. #CTCOVIDRESPONSE @EndHungerCT https://t.co/QZeM3jg7rW

I want to take a moment to express my gratitude to those who have worked to ensure our safety throughout #COVID19. To our healthcare workers retail employees cleaning crews teachers and others—it is because of your work that we will be able to beat this together. Thank you.

Thank you to all that participated in last night's live Tele-Town Hall discussion on the federal response to the Coronavirus. I was pleased to be joined by Dr. Richard A. Martinello of Yale New Haven Hospital and I hope that we were able to answer many of your questions.

My heart goes out to the family of the Connecticut man who died today from complications due to the coronavirus as well as all the health professionals involved who undoubtedly did their best to keep this from happening. https://t.co/98kOUqzo7Q

TONIGHT: Join me for a live telephone town hall meeting where I will provide a federal update on the coronavirus. To participate dial 855-920-0553 at 5PM. I look forward to hearing from you and taking your questions. https://t.co/wup8m6siaB

That is why Congress has taken swift action on two emergency bills in recent weeks to help our country deal with the coronavirus pandemic and stem its immediate impact on working people families and businesses.
This is a time of crisis. With thousands of positive coronavirus cases across the country and the case count rising exponentially people are rightly concerned. https://t.co/EG3AoBwRe6

As of this week our New Haven CT and Washington DC offices are serving constituents remotely in order to protect the public health and prevent the potential spread of coronavirus. (THREAD) https://t.co/GAQC5PEacF
Joined @WTNH yesterday afternoon to talk about what Congress is doing to deal with the coronavirus on the public health front and help ensure people are economically secure. https://t.co/9tRC14n9Hr

I am disappointed that in Congress’s latest coronavirus response bill the administration has left out tens of millions of workers from access to meaningful paid sick days or longer term paid leave including our frontline health care workers and first responders.

As businesses and schools shut down to prevent the spread of the coronavirus people are fearful of how they and their families are going to make ends meet. Congress has the power to change that—and we should.

Excellent interview with @jkbrennan & @ailsachang on how critical it is to follow @CDCgov and medical professionals’ guidance to avoid catching or spreading the coronavirus.  We have a responsibility to protect others and their families. https://t.co/FiykmK4lGf

To help we are providing free testing for coronavirus funding to help stabilize the unemployment insurance system 14 paid sick days for eligible workers as well as 12 weeks of paid leave for longer term care and food assistance.

I am glad that the USDA granted a waiver for Connecticut to ensure kids whose schools are shutting down will continue to have access to school meals. This is critical for keeping kids in low-income families from going hungry during the coronavirus public health emergency.

Proud to have worked with my colleagues @RepKatiePorter & @RepUnderwood to ensure cost is not a barrier for people getting tested for coronavirus. @CDCDirector Redfield must uphold this commitment. https://t.co/hQpTzmyKeq

This bill is directly targeted at helping working people and families affected by the coronavirus pandemic. Proud that it includes paid sick days paid leave food security and free diagnostic testing for all who need it. https://t.co/3cyAfy9gti

The coronavirus outbreak is affecting people in the U.S. and around the world—with the first case just reported in South Africa. We must ensure the CDC can help stop the spread of this virus wherever it is. https://t.co/no4ZaitdUa

Last week we appropriated $2.2 billion for the CDC to deal with the coronavirus outbreak—much of which will go to state and local health agencies who are on the frontlines dealing with this crisis. https://t.co/iZSwyi4sHi

Other countries have been testing thousands of people for weeks. But the U.S. is woefully behind the curve. The low number of positive tests in the U.S. is likely a by-product of under-testing as opposed to an accurate count of the prevalence of coronavirus in the U.S.

The Coronavirus outbreak is a crisis and there are questions about our country's preparedness and ongoing response efforts. I am very concerned about our nation’s testing capabilities for coronavirus. https://t.co/2JYgUoZ98I
Proud to lead this effort to ensure all people have access to affordable coronavirus testing with @RepKatiePorter & @RepUnderwood. https://t.co/E2SoyG9Hzg

Proud to get this $8.3 billion emergency funding bill to the stem the spread of the coronavirus quickly to the President’s desk. Especially important to help our state and local health agencies at this critical time. https://t.co/ZxR1DYI76b
Tune in at 10:00am as @NIHDirector and others testify before my subcommittee regarding the National Institutes of Health Budget Request for FY 2021 the coronavirus and more.  https://t.co/4uaJaBbuuN

Our federal government must be adequately prepared to deal with and prevent the spread of the coronavirus. That means having robust funding and a detailed plan of action—like President Obama and his administration presented when dealing with Ebola a few years ago. https://t.co/p2JIgYRKon
All while withholding key information about their efforts to date to stem the spread of the coronavirus.  That is unacceptable.

At the moment prominent medical experts believe influenza poses a far greater risk to people across the United States than the coronavirus. In Connecticut the Department of Public Health has already recorded 20 influenza-associated deaths this season.

The latest data on the spread of the Wuhan coronavirus in China and the United States is troubling. Given China’s disappointing record on food and medicine safety our federal government must be proactive in combating this virus and transparent in providing available information
